description: Expresses an action that continues on into the future or a change that progresses over time.
explanation:
### Name
- 〜ていく

### Meaning and function
- Indicates that an action or change starts now (or at a reference point) and will continue or develop into the future
- With motion nuance, shows “do V and then go (away)” or “take/bring something and go,” i.e., movement away from the current location or time frame

### Form and templates
- V-て + いく
  - Polite: V-ていきます
  - Past: V-ていった
  - Negative: V-ていかない / V-ていきません
  - Volitional: V-ていこう (intention/suggestion to continue from now on)
- Change over time (via なる)
  - い-adj(〜く) + なって + いく
  - な-adj + になって + いく
  - N + になって + いく
- Particle behavior
  - No special particle is required by 〜ていく itself; arguments of V take their usual particles (を, に, へ, で, と, etc.)
  - When 行く retains literal motion, destination is marked by へ/に as usual; objects being taken are marked with を, people being taken along with を/と depending on the verb
- Optional/alternative forms
  - 〜てく (casual contraction of 〜ていく in speech)
  - 〜てゆく (ゆく is a literary/poetic variant of いく; same meaning)
- Conjugation notes
  - The te-form of 行く is いって (not いいて), so further chaining gives V-ていって〜
  - For adjectives/nouns, attach 〜ていく through なる (not directly)

### Usage notes and constraints
- Two core readings
  - Aspect/time-direction reading: “go on doing; keep on; will continue to …” or “will progressively become …” (often with adverbs like これから, この先, だんだん, 少しずつ, 徐々に to stress gradual change)
  - Motion reading: “do V and go (away)” / “take along and go,” i.e., action plus departure from the current place or perspective
- Deixis and contrast with 〜てくる
  - 〜ていく: oriented away from the speaker/current time (into the future or away in space)
  - 〜てくる: oriented toward the speaker/current time (up to now or approaching here)
- Semantic scope
  - Natural with processes and gradual changes, repeated/habitual actions, or actions that can continue over time
  - For adjectives and nouns, always route through なる to express “become … and continue that change”
  - Avoid for single, instantaneous events if no continuation is implied (unless the motion reading is intended)
- Register and naturalness
  - Very common in conversation and writing; neutral register
  - 〜ていきます is polite; 〜てく is casual spoken only; 〜てゆく is literary/poetic and common in songs/poetry
  - Humble/business alternative (esp. for literal motion): 〜てまいります (more formal than N4 scope)
- Orthographic variants
  - 行く may be written as ゆく in set phrases or literary contexts; pronunciation follows the writing
  - Casual contraction drops い: 〜ていく → 〜てく in speech

### Common mistakes (optional, only if relevant)
- Attaching 〜ていく directly to adjectives/nouns; must use なる: い-adj(〜く)なっていく / な-adj・Nになっていく
- Using 〜ていく for changes that have progressed up to now; use 〜てくる for “up to the present,” 〜ていく for “from now on”
- Confusing V-ていく (do and go/continue) with V(stem)＋に行く (go in order to do); the former describes sequence/continuation, the latter expresses purpose of movement
- Using the casual contraction 〜てく in formal writing or polite speech
- Misspelling the te-form of 行く; it is いって, so past forms are V-ていった (not V-ていた)

### Related grammar (optional, only if relevant)
- 〜てくる: Continuation or change up to now / movement toward the speaker; time/space direction opposite to 〜ていく
- V(stem)＋に行く: “Go to do …” (purpose of movement), not “do and go” or “continue into the future”
- 〜続ける: Pure continuation without the time/space direction nuance; can combine with 〜ていく for “keep on and continue into the future”
- 〜ている: Ongoing action/state at reference time; neutral about future direction
- 〜ようになる: Onset of a habit/ability; contrasts with 〜になっていく (gradual change progressing forward)

examples.jp: これから日本語をもっと勉強していく。
examples.en: From now on, I’ll keep studying Japanese more.

examples.jp: この町は少しずつ静かになっていきます。
examples.en: This town will gradually become quieter.

examples.jp: 荷物を持っていってください。
examples.en: Please take the luggage with you and go.

examples.jp: 彼は挨拶もせずに走っていった。
examples.en: He ran off without even saying hello.

examples.jp: もう無理はしていかない。
examples.en: I won’t keep overdoing it anymore.

examples.jp: このやり方では成績はよくなっていきません。
examples.en: With this method, grades won’t improve over time.

examples.jp: この先も価格は上がっていくと思いますか。
examples.en: Do you think prices will keep going up from here on?

examples.jp: みんなで協力していこう。
examples.en: Let’s keep working together.

examples.jp: 季節はだんだん変わってゆく。
examples.en: The seasons gradually change as time goes on.

examples.jp: まずは宿題からやってく。
examples.en: I’ll start with the homework and keep at it.

examples.jp: 資料を会議室に持っていきます。
examples.en: I’ll take the materials to the meeting room.

examples.jp: 子どもを公園へ連れていく。
examples.en: I’ll take the child to the park.

examples.jp: 二人は話しながら歩いていった。
examples.en: The two of them walked off while talking.

examples.jp: 彼は大人になっていった。
examples.en: He gradually became an adult.

examples.jp: これからも笑顔を忘れずに生きていきたいです。
examples.en: I want to go on living without forgetting to smile.

examples.jp: このまま寒くなっていかないのか。
examples.en: Is it not going to keep getting colder like this?

examples.jp: 彼はドアを開けていってしまった。
examples.en: He opened the door and went off, leaving it open.

examples.jp: 雨は徐々に弱くなっていくだろう。
examples.en: The rain will gradually let up.

examples.jp: メモしていきますので、ゆっくり話してください。
examples.en: I’ll keep taking notes, so please speak slowly.

examples.jp: このプロジェクトを続けていけますか。
examples.en: Can we keep this project going?

negativeExamples.jp: 明日は早く家に行きます。
negativeExamples.en: Tomorrow I will go home early.

negativeExamples.jp: 宿題を終わらせに図書館へ行く。
negativeExamples.en: I’m going to the library to finish my homework.

negativeExamples.jp: ここでは写真を撮ってはいけません。
negativeExamples.en: You must not take photos here.

negativeExamples.jp: この先は行ってはならない。
negativeExamples.en: You must not go any farther.

negativeExamples.jp: 彼は荷物を持ってこなかった。
だんだん寒くなってきたね。
negativeExamples.en: It has gradually gotten colder, hasn’t it?

negativeExamples.jp: 資料を会議室に取りに行きます。
negativeExamples.en: I’ll go to the meeting room to pick up the materials.

negativeExamples.jp: 彼女は歌い続けると約束した。
行く人は手を挙げてください。
negativeExamples.en: Those who are going, please raise your hand.
